intro: Prismatomeris albidiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered prismatomeris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, shrub-like growth form. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbrella-like arrangements, which are typical of the carrot family. The leaves are finely divided and often have a silvery or grayish underside, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
